The Cabinet learned with great regret and sadness of thedeath of The Rt Hon Lord Butler of Saffron Walden, KG, CH.THE PRIME MINISTER recalled that it was almost exactly thirty years since Lord Butler, as Chancellor of the Exchequer in the Conservative Administration of the day, had introduced the first Conservative Budget of the post-war era. Subject to prior consultation with the Speaker and with the Leader of the Opposition, she would, before answering her first question in the House of Commons that afternoon, refer to the death of Lord Butler and indicate that there would be an opportunity for formal tributes in the House of Commons the following afternoon. No doubt the Chancellor of the Exchequer would also wish to refer to Lord Butler at the beginning of his Budget Speech that afternoon.The Cabinet -Took note.2. .THE CHANCELLOR OF THE EXCHEQUER informed the Cabinet of the proposals in his forthcoming Budget.In accordance with precedent details are not recorded in the Cabinet conclusions.Cabinet Office 9 March 1982CONFIDENTIAL
